title: Utilization Review Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI (Bremerton, WA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The posting for this position was on several external recruiting websites and the company's website. I sent in my application and immediately received calls and emails to set up an interview.  The interview was scheduled that week. I am highly qualified for the position so I took the zeal to secure an interview with me as a positive sign that they wanted to hire me (or someone like me). I logged in 10 minutes early and 1 of the 3 leaders that were scheduled to conduct the interview was on the Zoom meeting early.  She immediately advised me this position was for internal candidates only and she was sorry to waste my time but there would be no interview today.  In my experience, as a past nurse manager,  companies do not pay for internal positions to be posted on external recruiting websites. Internal positions are set up only to be viewed internally by employees.  However, I decided not to challenge the matter with her.  Either the company is so unorganized they post internal positions externally or she made an effort to be on the interview prior to anyone else to ensure the interview did not occur. Either way, this did not leave a positive impression of the company's hiring practices.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Corporate Counsel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at CHI (Denver, CO) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews for a role in their Denver-based legal department.  The initial phone screen with the recruiter was very positive—the recruiter was informative and the call was scheduled in a timely fashion.  The second interview was a phone interview with the hiring attorney.  The attorney missed our first appointment.  It took about two weeks to reschedule. Once we connected, the discussion was productive and very positive.   It took nearly a month of slow emails and poor communication to get the in-person interview scheduled.  The day of, things were very positive.  It was a standard interview with four of the other attorneys in the department.  The serious issues began after this third interview.  Communication from the recruiter (internal to CHI) was slow and often I had to initiate contact for updates.  I was repeatedly told “Let me check with the hiring attorney for an update” only to be left hanging or to receive an update that the attorney hadn’t made a decision yet.  This continued for ten weeks.  I accepted a position elsewhere and notified the recruiter in a final attempt to obtain some kind of update on their decision.   The recruiter never responded to me email.  The role I interviewed for was a director-level position—to not even receive a “thank you” or other acknowledgement of the time I spent waiting for an update is frankly disheartening.  I am very let down with the entire process.
Interview Questions: Describe your relevant experience.

title: Administrative Coordinator Nursing Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by an executive assistant to schedule a phone interview with her and two other department directors. The day before the interview I get a call saying they need to push the interview 15 minutes later which was understandable. The day of I receive a call from a director puts me on hold several times saying everyone in the department is sick. She then says she will call me back in 5 minutes along with the executive assistant to have the phone interview. The director calls back and says the executive assistant is not available anymore. She apologized and said this is usually not how they do things and said her assistant will call me back to reschedule. I reached out to her assistant several times and never had the chance to reschedule. Very disappointing since I was overqualified for the position and they didn’t give me the time of day for no apparent reason to discuss the opportunity. They overlooked my qualifications, made a colossal mockery of my time, humiliated their own interview integrity and ethics. They made me feel discriminated against without any single explanation as to why I was not even given a chance to interview. This is for Federal Way St Francis hospital in Washington. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Can I call you back in five minutes?

title: Registered Nurse - Operating Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Omaha, NE) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: You receive a phone call interview about ten minutes. They ask you basic personal information. Then you do an in person interview With two of the hiring managers over the OR. Then you do a peer interview where four people from the OR team sit down and ask you even more questions. You have the opportunity to ask questions throughout and at the end.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had conflict with a coworker or a higher up what did you do?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CHI
Interview Descriptions: I had applied and they had asked for me to come in for an interview a few days after I applied. It was about an hour long with the hiring manager. They described the role and day to day activities.
Interview Questions: They asked about strengths, weaknesses, situational questions such as how do you deal with a difficult situation or patients. They asked about my current position and why I want to leave. How do I go beyond and give excellent customer service, etc.

title: IT Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Houston, TX) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Human resources screener call then resume review and technical interview with the two hiring managers. Only phone interviews. I was located out of state so no face-to-face. Pretty easy process overall.
Interview Questions: Why CHI?

title: Cardiac Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI
Interview Descriptions: it was easy and the managers there were helpful in making me understand how the department works and the interview wasn't too formal. good environment and the people working there are nice
Interview Questions: What date can you start

title: EVS Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at CHI
Interview Descriptions: fair and friendly. they walk you through it every step of the way. a lot of it is on line l.... they will send you out a e-mail on step by step instructions. very simple
Interview Questions: can you work

title: RN Mother Baby Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three RNs. In person. They were really conversational and friendly. It lasted about an hour. They seemed to really care about what I wanted in a job, as well as what they wanted in a worker. They educated me about their unit and what my position would entail. They were very open to my questions. They also let me sit on the unit and talk to whoever I wanted and ask them questions for about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work on this unit?

title: Rehab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CHI (Des Moines, IA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through glassdoor but did not hear back from the company for about a month. I received a phone call to set up an interview that week. I met with rehab director and one other rehab tech for an interview with several questions. Ended with a tour of the hospital.
Interview Questions: When were you in a situation where you had to go above and beyond?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CHI (Omaha, NE) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: About 30 minutes to discuss previous experience. Set up by recruiter for phone screen interview. Second interview is face to face. Was told to expect a response in the following week or so.
Interview Questions: Questions about previous experience

title: Revenue Cycle Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview.  Make sure if you ever worked for St. Elizabeth or anyone that is affiliated with CHI's sister companies that you disclose that because they look at that stuff.  One interview, got an offer same day.  Basic questions, 5 year goals, experience in healthcare, what you like about healthcare, what is rewarding, etc.
Interview Questions: 5 year goals

title: Environmental Services Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at CHI (Bremerton, WA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I went to a hiring event, the interview was brief and involved the two main EST supervisors. It was a pleasant experience, with the normal questions like "what is your definition of integrity?" and "describe a difficult situation and how you handled it". I am mainly writing this review for one specific purpose, to point something out that is NOT discussed in the application or during the interview process - and that is CHI does NOT hire nicotine users of any form, even the patch (which I am on). I was completely unaware of this as I had a friend in this same position about 3 years ago who was a chain smoker. I don't know if this is something new or what? Once a contingent offer is made, they will do a drug screen which includes a nicotine test, which I did not know about until I went to get my lab requisitions and was told to go immediately for the screens. I came up positive due to my patch and my offer was rescinded, which I'm a little salty about but oh well. I think they hold this requirement back in order to prevent nicotine users from being deceptive - like quitting for a couple days while you're in the recruiting process and then going back to using? I don't know, I'm just putting this out there. If you use any form of nicotine, don't waste your time.
Interview Questions: What does the term "integrity" mean to you?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at CHI (Hot Springs, AR) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with Nursing Directors, CEO of the Hospital also toured the hospital as well. Met with the current Director and operation manager met some of the staff in the department.
Interview Questions: What my goal was for the first six months

title: Network Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CHI (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I got an interview call based on recommendation from my professor. The interview was largely focused around the items mentioned in my resume. It went kind of lengthy (30 minutes) but was absolutely comfortable.
Interview Questions: What are your personal skills

title: BI Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI (Denver, CO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews within two weeks. The process was  fine and clear. It starts with a phone screening from the HR specialist. Even though it went fast at the beginning, it took them 3 months to send back a reply
Interview Questions: What's a data warehouse?

title: Systems Specialist-Security Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Process took about 4 weeks. Head of security contacted me several weeks after I applied online to setup interview. Interviewed panel consisted of head of security and what appeared to be the incumbent position, a technician in a pretty close quarters conference room or closet. interview was pretty straight forward technical questions. First time I had been interviewed by outgoing personal which shows a good working relationship with stakeholders. A lot of position description explanation. No followup to interview, found out I didn't get the position by email stating, "Unfortunately, it’s not the right mutual match for the position", not sure what mutual match means.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working around death?

title: PCA II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I went to one of their job fares and it was ok. Everyone was nice and smiling hard. They ask basic interview questions and vital signs questions. The interview wasn’t long about 10-15mins.
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you went out of your way to help a patient.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CHI
Interview Descriptions: HR screen and combination of phone and onsite interviews with standard questions about experience. The onsite interview requests were always last-minute; I was happy to try to accommodate the interviewers but the experience signaled that CHI didn't seem particularly organized or accommodating.
Interview Questions: Describe your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fast, straight forward.  Met with human resources, and then met with the unit  manager.  Walked around unit, introduced to all staff.  At the end of interview I got offered the job pending HR paperwork.
Interview Questions: How well do you work under pressure?

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI (Bismarck, ND) in Dec 2017

Interview Questions: Wanted to know about my last position.

title: PCT/CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI (Little Rock, AR) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Long process but easy.  Interviewers were easy going and made me feel relaxed.  the interview was like a regular conversation.   However, after the interview, I did not get an orientation date until a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time you had to be flexible.

title: LVN Intake Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Lufkin, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long. I applied and after hearing nothing I went in person to check on my application, 3 days later I got a call for an interview. After the interview I came in for a 'trial' shift (unpaid) and was subsequently told that would be contacted. After hearing nothing I emailed my interviewer to see if I needed to do something else and was told no, that I was just waiting for HR to make me an offer via phone or email. After waiting another week I call and am told that they are working on it and I should receive and offer in the next day or 2. After waiting another week I go up there in person and state I would really like some info on what's happening as it's been over a month and I either need to start ASAP or I need to go look elsewhere. I was told they would look into and call me back. I then get a call saying that job has been put on hold and they can't tell me why but they are unable to hire me until the hold is released. I then contacted my interviewer and never heard back. I called HR and my calls were never returned. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!!!
Interview Questions: How long I've been a nurse?

title: MRI Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (The Woodlands, TX) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter sets up interview, then interview with director manager or lead. Arrive to HR then wait, but first do a personality survey on line. Interview with department heads then Recruiter. Tour department.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Bryan, TX) in Oct 2017

title: Medication Reconciliati Technician Interview

The culture of the job changes from floor to floor and from hospital to hospital.  Overall the people are great and easy to get along with.
Interview Questions: They were the standard questions.  Tell us about a time you felt with a difficult situation?

title: Grants Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Lincoln, NE) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about 3 weeks. Applied online - received a phone call to set up an in-person interview. I interviewed with 2 people. Very pleasant and they answered all my questions. I got job offer in about a week after my interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Executive Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: How I would handle a difficult situation.

title: Staff RN Interview

Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in a few years?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview

The representative was very friendly and was screening applicants based on qualifications, location of worksite and hours available. He briefly described the position, work duties and scheduling but didn't mention salary. I was not able to meet the scheduling requirements so the interview did not go any further.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI (Bryan, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Screening followed by a face- to- face interview. The phone screening is mainly to get a feel for the person. To see if it is a good fit for both parties. The in-person Interview had similar questions but more in-depth about work ethics.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what are your weaknesses and strengths.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Chattanooga, TN) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was kind of odd. I was interviewed by three individuals, only one being the manager. After everything was done and over with, I took a tour of  the department where I was shown the different equipment and systems that were utilized daily.  Once the tour was over I was instructed that I should be receiving a call in about a week.
Interview Questions: Who is your favorite band?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CHI (Chattanooga, TN) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a really good interview. The nurses were very nice on the telephone. She was very honest about the salary and the benefits. Explained she would have to check about the salary.
Interview Questions: Previous education?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CHI (New York, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: glass door helped me in preparing for the interview porcess. it waas a phone interview and it lasted for some twenty minutes. preparing early always helps to gaain advantage over the interviewer
Interview Questions: why do want to work here?

title: CMA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at CHI (Chattanooga, TN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was fortunate! I had just finished my clinical practicum there at the office and had already been offered a job, and they knew my character and work ethic already so I only had to do a required phone "interview" where we chatted about the position. I got the job and started about 3weeks later after background check and drug screen....
Interview Questions: They didn't. They said ive got the job if I want it!

title: Laboratory Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CHI (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the HR person for an interview. On the day of, the manager came to meet me at the front desk and he took me to the conference room in which he interviewed me with technical questions and the HR person as more like personality tests.
Interview Questions: Manager interviewed me technical questions like laboratory testing of specific tests

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was about one hour long with the hiring manager and an educator. They walked through a series of about eight behavioral questions, allowed time for me to ask all of my questions throughout and at the end of the interview, then gave me a tour of the unit. It was a very friendly interview, and we all were laughing at a couple points! Overall, it was not a hard interview, but make sure you prep a bit for the behavioral questions and you'll do fine.
Interview Questions: What kind of person do you enjoy working with and what kind of person do you know enjoy working with and why?

title: Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screening with the recruiter, and I was then scheduled for an on-site interview. I live out-of-state but Franciscan was not able to reimburse me for travel expenses. Flew to Tacoma for a half-day of interviews: spoke with the medical director, the head of behavioral health, an administrative VP, a nurse, a social worker, and another provider. I was then told that they wanted to interview another candidate in a couple of weeks and I would be hearing back then. Didn't hear anything within that timeline, so I called and was told that interviews had been delayed and could I wait another week? The same thing the next week, and then the next. So between completing the interview and receiving the final form email about not getting an offer, I waited approximately a month and a half.

All the same, I don't think the interview process was bad enough to rate as negative. The recruiter consistently returned my calls and emails, and although I'm not sure I believe the whole "interviews are delayed" thing as an explanation for why I had to wait so long, she was nice and courteous with me all through the process. All the interviewers were friendly and down-to-earth as well. If given the opportunity, I'd apply again.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to move to Tacoma?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at CHI (Springfield, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was connected through an outside recruiting service and had a phone interview with the hospital inpatient and outpatient managers. They were very thorough in their questioning on clinical knowledge.
Interview Questions: How would you treat a recent knee replacement?

title: Financial Intake Interview

Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview 1st with a recruiter of the company and then was contacted  for an interview with the director. The interview went well, asked typical questions.  Very personable and polite people.

title: IT Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

title: HIM Representative Interview

Interview Questions: What does HIPAA mean to you?

Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you disagreed with a coworker and how did you handle the situation?

title: Nurse Aide Interview

Interview Descriptions: Just submitted an informal application and went in for an easy interview the next week.  I was hired a few days and some paperwork later. Training was on the job.
Interview Questions: What is the best times I could work?

title: Marketing Interview

Interview Descriptions: Meet directly with CEO and then panel interview with peer leadership. Asked many questions related to previous job performance and contacted my references. There was some negotiation with salary and benefits. Mission and Core Values were discussed frequently.
Interview Questions: How would you integrate our core value into your  management style?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Louisville, KY) in Mar 2016

title: Student Nurse Interview

title: Advance Respiratory Therapist Interview

Interview Questions: What are my biggest strengths.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Patient Access Representative II Interview

Interview Questions: Interview with both the manager and supervisor---the questions were all "name a time when" lots of questions on when you de-escalated a situation, how you would resolve co-worker issues, and customer service questions. Last question was why should we hire you, first question was why did you apply.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CHI (Bryan, TX)

Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a difficult patient

title: Marketing Specialist Interview

Overall, the process seemed long, but I appreciate that valued the entire team's input. Seemed like most people asked the same very generic questions. Overall, I would say that it was an average interview.

title: Marketing Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online and received a phone screening from the hiring manager. After about 3 days I was asked to come in for a 4 hour interview where I was scheduled to meet with the entire team in groups. After the group interviews, I was asked to come in about a week later to interview with the VP of Marketing.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple competing deadlines?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Omaha, NE) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with interviewer and answered approximately 6 opened ended questions about my qualifications and skilled.  I gave clear and concise answers with examples.  At the end, I asked questions about the next steps that would take place in the interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to support multiple people and how you prioritized your workload.

title: Respiratory Therapy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Hot Springs, AR) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I heard back within 2 weeks of applying for this Job. I was told what my salary would be over the phone and given a date to come to orientation. Orientation took a few hours, this is where they cover all details including benefits. I was set up with an EPIC (computer program) class. I orientated with coworkers for 3 to 4 weeks before I started on my own.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 10 years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Straight to the point. Did not paint a pretty picture as to expectations but didn't turn out so bad once hired. I can not remember the rest of the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI (Hot Springs, AR) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on a job site. I was contacted by the local recruiter who then arranged for a phone interview. This was followed by an in person interview at their facility.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to Hot Springs

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CHI in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Laid back but took a few months before an offer was made.  This hospital will be closing in less than 2 years...so if you are considering a job here I suggest doing some research first.

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: One phone Interview followed by in office interview. Interview questions are super basic and familiar to the position. title: Data Analyst Interview

Entailed the classic three levels (Initial screening by phone by the "first line of defense", follow-up phone call by the hiring manager, then the in-person interview with a 3-person panel).  After the in-person stage it took  another three weeks to be notified of their decision.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied online, received a call from a nurse recruiter the next day and had an interview the following week. The interview consisted of 2 supervisors for the area I was applying to.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was awesome! So friendly and welcoming! So much laughter and fun. I've never had such a fun interview. I loved the ladies that interviewed me. It wasn't uncomfortable at all
Interview Questions: What made you want to become a nurse?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CHI
Interview Descriptions:
Went very smoothly. Scheduled phone interviews were done on time without any delays or confusion with prompt follow ups. Multiple stage interviews starting with HR, Manager, Director, Providers...
Process took about 2-3 weeks to complete since the time of application. 

Negotiations went well, but not much wiggle room. Was able to get + X bonus, + Y bonus, + ^ salary.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time...
Give me an example of...
How would you handle...
How did you overcome...
Strength/weakness

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at CHI (Englewood, CO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Single in-person interview with the hiring manager.  Conversation topics generally focused on the initiatives I've managed in my current position.  There were some insightful questions about my management style and projects. 

The interviewer didn't seem terribly familiar with my resume prior to the interview.  He didn't seem to build much of a rapport with me, either.  Maybe that's part of why I didn't get an offer. :-)

Overall, it was a combination of "tell me what you've done" and behavioral interviewing.  The questions were read off a list and there didn't seem to be much deviation from the list as a result of my answers.  In retrospect, that probably wasn't a great sign, either.

After that interview, they apparently deviated from the next steps that I was told in the interview but that could be an artifact of subsequent communications running through the recruiter.
Interview Questions: How do you avoid getting into the weeds as a manager with strong technical skills?

title: Regional Tax Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Englewood, CO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: They asked the standard questions: tell me about yourself, describe successes and failures (follow up with what you learned from failures) provide examples of how your experience matches the posted job description. BE SURE to ask details of their expectation and details of what the day to day job looks like. Ask exactly what skills are required to meet expectations.
Interview Questions: See above

title: Information Security Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Englewood, CO)
Interview Descriptions: The first part of it is the phone interview. This is where you get an idea from the manager and follow-on interviewer as to their concept of the position and what it entails. It's very much one of those organizations that once your foot is in the door, you are good to go from there.

title: Learning Management Systems Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CHI (Des Moines, IA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
This was one of the most humiliating hiring processes I have ever been though.

I interviewed and was offered a position at Mercy College of Health Sciences, which is under Catholic Health Initiatives. I applied online. The application process included an approximately 45 minute aptitude test with SAT-like problem solving questions (questions like: if Person A is travelling from point A at 55 mph, and Person B is travelling from Point B at 40mph, when do they meet in the middle?). I thought that was a bit odd for an application, but I continued on with the process. I received an invitation to interview a few days later. 

The initial interview was on the phone with a friendly and knowledgeable HR rep. The in person interview included a meeting with the provost, a presentation to a small group (that I was given resources to prepare for), and a one on one interview with the manager for the position. Everyone involved was friendly and respectful. I was offered the position that afternoon at 54k/yr, and negotiated up to 56k/yr. I accepted at that point. 

I came onsite to complete a drug screening and finish filling out paperwork. Even though I was not applying for a position in a health field, the amount of paperwork was quite extensive. I went in to give a urine sample and was not able to urinate enough for what they wanted. I was told I could have a second try and could not leave the premises in the interim. I drank some water and waited. For the second try, a nurse said she was required to stand in the room a few feet from me. I was fairly stressed out at this point as I needed to get back to my current job and was under pressure to pee in front of someone, which is not pleasant. I simply could not do it because I was intensely uncomfortable and embarrassed at this point.

The offer was rescinded for that reason. They did not give any alternatives -- it was pee on command or have the job offer taken back. The manager and HR rep I talked to tried to look into what they could do, but could not do anything. I find it unbelievable that they were willing to reject candidates because they could not urinate enough. Instead of providing some type of alternative test, which they are perfectly equipped to do being a hospital system, they will instead be spending more time, money, and resources to find another candidate.
Interview Questions: How do you handle people who do not follow the instructions you give them?

title: Physician and Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: My fiancé and I are both in medicine (different specialties) and interviewed for positions at FMG/SJMC in Tacoma over the summer of 2012. We were both extended written offers shortly following our interviews. During my interviews, I was led to believe that I was interviewing for a newly created medical director position for an expanding service. However, the offer letter specified a staff level position and a salary offer that was less than the median.  The real problems with leadership and administration's lack of transparency and integrity emerged during negotiations over a 2-month period. I found it odd that in late stage negotiations, the physician recruiter continued to be the point of contact rather than physician leadership or administration.  During my second meeting with FMG leadership to finalize our negotiations, I was assured of their commitment to employ me and to resolve the few outstanding issues. The CEO indicated that he would have resolution and would contact me by a specified date; however, he never called. During the next 2 weeks, I attempted to contact the CEO on many occasions to no avail. My calls and emails were ignored. I was surprised to learn of the CEO's decision to hire another physician for the position in an email that he inadvertently sent to my fiancé and to several other uninvolved individuals on the distribution list. After the email blunder, he lacked the professionalism and courtesy to contact me to apologize or to offer an explanation. My fiancé has a similar unfavorable opinion of FMG leadership. Her requests for clarification regarding key responsibilities, reporting mechanism, contractual terms were dismissed by administration. She was told that rather than being overly concerned about the details of the job, "it is more important to employ the right person."  Her letter of offer contained the name of another individual within the narrative. Maybe a simple oversight, but when taken altogether, in our opinion, the leadership was dishonest or non-transparent at the minimum, grossly unprofessional and cost us valuable time and energy in our pursuit of employment.
Interview Questions: I applied on line for a posted position. When I arrived at the interview, I discovered that I was being interviewed for another position within the same department.

title: QA Automation Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CHI (Englewood, CO) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: There will be just one interview. Will try to get to know the person, his experience , Technologies he worked and his implementation methodologies etc. Once you clear the interview there will be Back ground check and Drug test required. Will try to get feedback from linked in resources before the interview
Interview Questions: Joining Date move couple of times. That was frustrating part

title: Manager, Learning and Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: 30-minute conversation with a kind and helpful internal recruiter, 45-minute phone interview with the hiring manager, 2-hour onsite interview with the hiring manager and his boss (VP), then an assignment to analyze a complex performance problem and make a presentation to several stakeholders of my analysis and solutions. Everyone was kind, respectful, and attentive.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when training was requested, but you felt that training was not the solution.

title: Ambulatory Services Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Lexington, KY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very lengthy.  I have an initial interview with a recruiter.  Followed by an interview with who would be my supervisor.  Then an interview with supervisor and her manager.  And finally a 20 minute presentation in front of the whole team including other trainers and the supervisor.  The whole process was about 8 weeks because they were not ready to hire for the market that I was applying for.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with opposing viewpoints and conflicts when working on a team?

title: Patient Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Franciscan is a great place to work, which I what enticed me to apply. I met with a recruiter at a career fair, who referred me to a job posting. I applied on Monday, got called the next for an interview. The interview went great, I really enjoyed our conversation and learning about their values. Unfortunately, I was not offered the job as she said it came between myself and another candidate, and he/she was choosen. This, however, gave me the encouragement to keep trying. I will definitely be applying for jobs within the FHS organization. It's not about what I want to do, at this point, it's where I want to go.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CHI (Florence, KY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: VERY LIMITED AND INTERVIEWED BY INDIVIDUALS THAT REALLY HAVE NO IDEA ABOUT THE ROLE. The upper management is not truethfull about on call and how it effects your routine. They also are cluless about there EHR. It was an easy interview.
Interview Questions: Are you available on weekends

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CHI (Erlanger, KY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process from initial job application/resume submission to the final turndown took over three months.  I interviewed first with a recruiter via a phone screen, then a phone interview with the hiring manage ane the recruiter.  I was invited on-site for a panel of interviews with a panel of six over a four hour period.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you instead of the other candidates we are considering?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at CHI in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: There were several interviews with a lot of different people.  I did not fully understand the position.  I feel like it wasn't explained well. Some of the people I interviewed with were super friendly, and others were much colder, but that is to be expected at any company.  Overall, it was a good interview experience.
Interview Questions: There weren't any really unexpected questions.  They asked all the typical questions...what are your weaknesses, where do yo want to be in 5 years, what are your career goals...

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CHI (Des Moines, IA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal applicant.  For all internal and External applicants HR has all say.  The hiring managers have very little say in how much someone gets paid.  I had staff that were in 3 different states doing the same thing but there was a 20K disparity in yearly pay.  It was sickening.
Interview Questions: From your experience why do you think you have the ability to do the job.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CHI (Denver, CO) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was laborious; lengthy and convoluted. Interviews started in December, continued into January, began again in March, and ended in April. Organization mission and vision were the key deciding factors.
Interview Questions: The questions were usual and customary: biggest, longest, hardest, learned the most, greatest mistake, remarkable success, etc.

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at CHI in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had gotten a call to set up the interview. The day of the Interview was really easy . They asked me the easiest questions. The unit secretary came asked a question and that was about it.
Interview Questions: I do not recall any questions that were unexpected or hard. As long as you are great at what you do you should be oil.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CHI (Denver, CO) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening interview, then interview with another Executive Assistant and HR Representative
Interview Questions: You will be supporting a very demanding company officer, how will you communicate with him without wasting his time?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CHI (Englewood, CO) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: My resume was sent from staffing agency and I had a telephone interview conducted by an Executive Assistant.  I went to an interview with one of the 4 directors I was supporting.  He made the decision
Interview Questions: Asked how I felt about starting a meeting with a "reflection"

title: Applications Analyst II Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Englewood, CO) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Multiple phone interviews with recruiter, manager, various application groups, and directors. Company is relatively thorough, including background checks, reference checks, and drug test. Interview process takes a very long time given the number of people you'll need to interview with, and the recruiters are very busy, so check in with the recruiters often to keep things moving. Make them aware if you have other offers pending, as they will likely be slower to move than anyone else you're interviewing with.
Interview Questions: Be prepared to be able to explain how your current co-workers would describe you.

title: Organizational Effectiveness Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Denver, CO) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Two disappointing observations: 

1/ The two director level individuals I interviewed with were unorganized, unprofessional and unprepared and incompetent.  The interview (we had a conference bridge set up) was a cluster.  One director did not have the conference bridge number despite the fact that it was sent to all parties in an outlook invitation.  While I was waiting on the conference bridge my call waiting beeped in with one director (she said she could not find the conference bridge number).  I thought I was talking with a child that lost her lunch money. The other director did not show until the out time was about out.  Basic professionalism and personal responsibility was nonexistent.  These two individuals and their boss should be embarrassed.

2/ There were very anti-men and it seemed to me there were much more interested in hiring a a female.  As a healthcare employee this discrimination again a men seems to be excepted and celebrated.   

There are many reasons that explain the cause of the current healthcare crisis.  The lack of accountability and professionalism of many healthcare employees plays a big role in this crisis.
Interview Questions: Questions were simple but due to the fact that the directors used a speaker phone instead of the established conference bridge it was difficult to hear them.

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CHI in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively easy.  I received a call to schedule my interview and met with the office manager and department lead once.  I was offered the position that same day and once my background check was completed, I was able to start orientation.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions; what are your strengths, what are your weaknesses, etc.  The most difficult was coming up with a scenario in which you have to show problem solving ability.  Not too hard.

title: Application Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Englewood, CO) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Can be lengthy, even if the position needs desperately to be filled.  The job has to be posted internally for at least a week.  Then it goes public.  Interview is done by a panel of managers and peers.  Interviewers take turns asking questions from a scripted list, with follow-up questions.
Interview Questions: You may be asked if you have any concerns about working for a faith-based org.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Long phone interview with hiring manager then in person with next manager up.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: EPMO Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Englewood, CO) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I started out with a phone screen by the recruiter at CHI.  I then got a phone screen with a member of the team I would be a member of.  Once I passed those phases, I was was then set up to come in for a half day marathon interview session with multiple directors (within the EPMO).  It was scheduled for 2 hours, but they handed me a new schedule when I got there that was extended to 4 hours (no consideration of my time and simply said if I didn't want the job I could leave).  Once I got through this round of interviews they left me hanging for weeks.  Finally, got a second round of multiple interviews (same thing - 4 hours with basically the same people).  Then waited several weeks and was finally made an offer.  

During this process I was asked for examples of work and presentations I had put together.  From what I can tell, they didn't actually look at any of it, but I did have to provide it.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working for a faith based organization?

title: Quality Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI (Little Rock, AR) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy, one interview but manager was a bad communicator and kept forgetting day- to-day tasks, had to remind him EVERYTHING. He should NOT be in this position, out of state employee. He an corporate executive and was on the internet all day long, not work related.
Interview Questions: Many questions, typical interview questions, not hard at all.

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Apply Online at http://www.fhshealth.org/Doctors-And-Clinics/Jobs/
Waited about 2 weeks to hear back.
Scheduled an interview with current director and site supervisor (manager)
Interview was pretty quick and concise, one of the least stressful interviews I have ever had.
In 48 hours I had all my prehire paperwork for drug screenings, etc.
Interview Questions: "Are you ok dealing with dead people?"

title: Public Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CHI in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had a panel interview with four people in the communications/PR department. The environment was fairly positive and the interview questions were typical. The worst part of the experience was getting an automated message from their online HR tracking system saying I wasn't selected--long before receiving a letter in the mail.
Interview Questions: Don't recall any overly unexpected questions; there were a couple of situational-type ones.

title: Diagnostics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CHI (Tacoma, WA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Two different people were offered positions.  The HR department than telephoned and stated "we misunderstood their offered".  Shame on them for calling themself a faith based company as decent is a standard.
Interview Questions: They questions were standard for after working there, I recognize, the reason they have a hard time hiring is their reputation.

title: Applications Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at CHI (Englewood, CO) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: They can take up to 30 days to even give you an interview and the communication is shoddy at best.
Interview Questions: Nothing really general information on what your job will consist of.

title: Patient Accounts Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CHI (Lincoln, NE) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: applied for different position than what was offered.
Interview Questions: N/A
